svcsubproc.title: Windshield Removal

note.para: There are many variations of window and glass arrangements installed in school bus applications. However, the installation and maintenance procedures given in this section can be used as a general information that is contingent on state specifications (optional equipment)

svcsubproc.para: All glass in this vehicle meets F.M.V.S.S. requirements. Should the glass require replacing, replace with the same type of glass and glass mounting seal. The windshield is a flat four piece assembly. Replacing the windshield assembly requires a qualified glass technician and helper. The windshield is an AS-1 laminated safety glass, tinted 73% light transmission and sealed with a rubber "H" style gasket and lock lace. Installation of the windshield lace requires standard window glass tools readily available at automotive glass suppliers.

note.para: An assistant is required in the removal and installation of the windshield assembly.

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or death, always wear safety glasses and gloves when handling glass.

svcsubproc.para: If the glass is broken, it may already have fallen or been removed from the rubber seal. It is often necessary to remove cracked or otherwise imperfect glass that is still intact. In this case, it is a good practice to criss-cross the glass with strips of masking tape before removal. This will help hold the glass together and minimize the risk of injury.

step1.para: Beginning at the center of the windshield at the bottom glass seal of the windshield panel to be removed, pry out the windshield lock lace from the groove around the entire perimeter of the glass panel. If a windshield side panel is to be replaced just remove the lace lock seal from around the side panel.

calloutgroup.callout1: WINDSHIELD LOCK LACE REMOVAL AND TOOL

step1.para: Removal can begin at either wing panel. For easy removal a putty knife or non metallic flat tool can be use to insert between the glass and seal to release the glass from the seal.
While releasing the glass from the seal an assistant should apply pressure pushing the upper portion of the panel in an outward direction.

calloutgroup.callout1: DRIVER SIDE CENTER PANEL LOCK LACE REMOVAL

step1.para: Remove the panel from the seal and place on a padded table to prevent any damage.
Beginning in the upper corner where wing panel glass was removed, insert tool to release center glass panel from window seal. Continue across top surface of center windshield panel.

calloutgroup.callout1: ASSISTANT'S HAND FROM INSIDE (PUSHING GLASS OUTWARD)

step1.para: As the seal is being released, an assistant should be applying pressure along the upper windshield surface, pushing the glass outward.

When the windshield and seal have been released from the windshield frame assembly at the top of the windshield, remove the vertical seal from the outboard edge of the glass. The assistant should be steadying glass during the procedure to remove the windshield seal.
Remove the seal from the upper edge of the center windshield glass.
With an assistant slide the glass toward the side of the bus (the side with wing panel previously removed), lift glass out of bottom seal, and remove from bus.
If windshield glass is going to be re-used (not broken or cracked) store on padded stand until ready to install.
Check windshield mounting frame for any damage before installing new seal and or glass.
